common_errors.cause: No coredumps stored, or filtered criteria too restrictive
common_errors.solution: Remove filters, or check coredump collection: sysctl kernel.core_pattern

common_errors.cause: Cannot access coredumps (not root, or coredump contains sensitive data)
common_errors.solution: Use sudo: sudo coredumpctl list. Or adjust /etc/systemd/coredump.conf permissions.
Ensure systemd-coredump is installed and kernel.core_pattern points to it.

common_errors.cause: Cannot find original binary for coredump analysis
Coredump file missing or corrupted in journal
common_errors.solution: Coredump may have been vacuumed. Check journal retention settings.
Install gdb: apt install gdb / yum install gdb

common_errors.cause: Binary is stripped, limiting debug usefulness
common_errors.solution: Install debug symbols: apt install <pkg>-dbgsym. Or rebuild with -g.

common_errors.cause: Coredumps stored externally, not in journal
common_errors.solution: Check /var/lib/systemd/coredump/ for files, or change Storage= in coredump.conf
Check filter syntax. Use: PID=123, COMM=myapp, _EXE=/usr/bin/myapp
